Whew chile, when I tell you the food here is REALLY GOOD, its the truth. I came for a date night one evening and we ordered the Goi Ga and the Roasted Bone Marrow. You would think that you couldn't elevate the taste of bone marrow but I was mistaken. Not only was it flavorful but it paired well with the bread. Chef's Kiss for sure. The chicken in the Goi Ga was so flavorful and juicy that I'm still thinking about it one week later. As for entrees, we got the BBH Beef Shank and it was a flavor explosion in my mouth. It was so much food that we had to take 75% of it home. The ambiance was very cute and the lighting made it a perfect spot for a date. This spot has solidified itself for top of my list and I will be returning.

Came here on a Saturday night with a reservation. It is not a big restaurant and was pretty packed, so I definitely recommend making a reservation. We were sat at the back of the restaurant and had ample space. Ordered a bunch of dishes including the banh mi board, monsieur platter, roasted bone marrow, ba's grilled shrimp, com chien cua, and the beef shank. Banh mi board came out first, and boy, it was delicious. Basically a deconstructed banh mi. Monsieur platter was good too, but wasn't anything amazing. The shrimp and bone marrow were exceptional and everyone at the table agreed. The plate that didn't really impress me was the beef shank. It was bland and lacked flavor for me, and my fiance agreed. And the price tag.. $125 lol I'd go again and order everything except the beef shank and platter. Oh, and drinks were on point too.

Came here for a birthday and it was so good! We got the banh kot, Monsieur Platter, and the bone marrow. It was very filling for two people. I recommend the Monsieur platter it's like a diy summer roll, delicious and fun. Service is super friendly and attentive.

We ordered the grilled shrimps (so tasty I wanted more!), roasted bone marrow (so yummy! One of my favorite), and the Monsieur platter (a little twist to classic spring rolls! The meats were good!). The cocktails were amazing! They literally tasted like juice (dangerous!). I definitely want to come back here and try their other items on the menu!

Great casual ambiance. Laid back. Tables were very close together. Fast service. Bone marrow was the fave of the night.

I had a good experience here with a couple of nitpicks that are really just personal preferences. The marrow has a nice salty texture on the surface. It has a nice kick and might be a little too salty on it's own but the baguette cuts it very nicely. The crispy rice did crispy rice things and that Vietnamese sausage and anchovy had that bacon effect (where it just makes things better). The okra was flavorful but i like my fried Okra to not be so wet - i would have preferred the dressing to be a dip. I'll eat this place again.

This might've been the best meal I had in NYC in 2022. Everything was absolutely delicious and I want to go back and try the rest of the menu. The standout was absolutely the Beef Shank. The dish was both huge and rich but I couldn't get enough. The beef tartare, the grilled shrimp, and the banh mi charcuterie board were all amazing as well. The service was fast, friendly, and attentive. The restaurant itself was buzzing even though it was a Wednesday night, and absolutely a place where I will be bringing others to.

One of the most authentic delicious Vietnamese food you can get outside Vietnam and on par or better than CA restaurants.

Great variety of food that hits all flavor profiles that you crave from Vietnamese food. I would recommend getting a little bit of everything to share with the table, that way you maximize your ability to try different plates, rather than committing yourself to only one entrée.
Delicious. Will be back. The fried okra was perfection. Ordered the Monsieur platter for main. Great way to taste different dishes.

A fun shareable Vietnamese culinary experience. All the food was extremely tasty. Can't wait to come back with a large group to try their larger shareable dishes like the beef shank. Well priced natural wine options. Bone marrow and brothless pho were the highlights. 10/10 would Recommend. The owner was also lovely. Thanks monsieur vo.

Everything was so delicious, the com chay was my favorite along with the fish. The ambiance was super cute and the owners were very friendly , loved this place! Will definitely come back on my next trip back to NYC!

Went on a Saturday afternoon with kids, amazing service and scrumptious food! We had to order the calamari again as the kids ate it all! The pizza was out of the world with high quality mozzarella and lemon, a very different taste altogether a most go! Will try the pasta next time, this place will give some of the known pizza joint run for their money in nyc. Overall the Tin building has a unique ambiance with options for multiple kinds of cuisines. Overall a very kid friendly place

First time to the Tin Building by Jean-George. We ordered the Limone pizza and the arugula & fennel salad. The pizza was very unique and unlike any pizza I've ever had. The lemon adds a tangy flavor that complemented the ricotta. I'll definitely go back again!

The Frenchman's Dough is one of the full-service restaurants in the Tin Building and is located on the second floor. Overall, the servers were very friendly and the food was good, but nothing blew me away. I probably won't return since I think there are better options out there at this price point. My friend and I ordered the Truffle Shuffle pizza and Paccheri pasta. Again, they were both good, but they weren't the most flavorful, didn't come out warm/hot enough, and were a small portion.

Went exploring @tinbuilding after work, and the food at Frenchman's Dough was amazing! Accurately described as "Italian with a twist". The pizza was super flavorful with the truffles, and the egg and cheese was a great balance. The pasta with ragu has a kick of spice, and the pasta itself was very chewy and sophisticated. Loved it so much!

Tasty and unique pizza - loved the lemon and ricotta pizza and added some chili oil on top. Parmesan and arugula salad was good too but a bit too sour. Pizza was very thin. Tasty but nothing too special. Fun location too in the Tin Building. Very friendly and efficient staff

I recently came here with a friend. We sat at the bar which was pleasant although pretty hot since the pizza oven is nearby. If you tend to run hot choose your seat carefully. There was a nice choice of wine by the glass and good choices of pizza and pasta. I got the cacio e pepe pasta, which was good but not as good as what I've had at similar Italian restaurants. My friend had pasta with clams which she said was great. We finished with the cheesecake which was truly outstanding. Service was great, super friendly and efficient, always there when needed but not overbearing. I'd absolutely return when I'm downtown, just not sure if I'd go out of my way to come back.

Get the burrata. Don't even think about it. Just order it. The truffle pizza is next level, and the veal special is a must if they happen to have it when you go. I feel like we spoke to everyone, not one member of the staff just walked by without asking how everything was. Even though it's in the middle of a busy market, it doesn't feel like it they do a good job of blocking off that noise as much as possible.

Please see the picture of the Chicken Parma below. Full disclosure: I requested no mozzarella since I'm lactose intolerant. HOWEVER, this dish comes as you see, without pasta (I was told that if I wanted pasta it would cost an additional $22.00) and without sauce. Also, the cutlet was burnt. How much did it cost? $28.00. The picture speaks for itself. I should have known to avoid the Tin Building, since some weeks ago, I purchased a Sesame Bagel there that was old and stale. Go at your own risk.

One of my fave spots in NYC for wood fired pizza. The servers are friendly, and the space is beautiful. If I'm just stopping in for a quick bite I like to sit at the kitchen counter to watch the pizzas get made. My favorite pizzas tend to be the ones made with squash, but every pizza I've had has been delicious.

Food is amazing, especially the burrata with figs and the pizza. Skip the breadsticks, wish they served fresh bread instead.

Everything we ordered was delicious.  The calamari had just the right crunchy breading.  The mushroom pizza was loaded with roasted mushrooms, more than your average pie. The cacio e pepe pasta was some of the best we've tried.  We were very happy they were generous with the amount of clams in the pasta dish.  The wood-fired cheesecake was a great ending to the meal.  It managed to be both light and intensely flavored.  If you're looking for a non-alcoholic drink, the cherry yuzu soda was just the right amount of sweetness.  Finally, while the staff was extremely busy and likely undermanned, they were always smiling and provided great service.

The food is quite excellent. A casual, comfortable spot with fabulous beers & nice wine selection. GM is a terrific, caring fellow. Well worth trying when down at the seaport. Upstairs in the Tin Building. As a luxury & lifestyles magazine editor, I highly recommend you give it a shot!

Leaving three stars because the food was good but the service was trash. First, we had to wait 30 mins to be seated for a table for two, despite seeing multiple empty tables when we checked in. After waiting the 30 mins, we were seated though it didn't appear like the host was going to let us know a table was ready when we came back to check despite collecting my phone number earlier. After we got seated, a waitress filled our water glasses and walked away. We proceeded to sit there for 30 mins before someone came by with menus. Other parties, some larger than two people came, ate and left while we waited. We finally got to order and got the calamari, and the brussels pizza. We also ordered two drinks. The calamari showed up minutes after we ordered. The pizza took longer. The calamari was okay but had too much parm. The pizza was delicious though! Our drinks arrived at the table right as we were finishing up the pizza - basically at the end of the meal. We were not pleased with the service so we were trying to just get the check and go. The waiter assigned to our table did not come to check in or anything as he appeared to be too busy tending to every other of his tables except ours. I made eye contact and signaled for the check. After the check arrived and we put a card down, it took him at least 15-20 mins to come back and get it - because I made eye contact with him again to come get it. I was very disappointed with my experience, especially since I was celebrating my birthday. The food was good but I wouldn't come back to get ignored by the servers.

Unpleasant experience. The place was empty but the host said there's a 40 min wait. It was just me and my husband. When my husband inquired about the empty tables, the host changed the time to 10 to 15 min wait, strange, but no big deal. At the table, unfortunately, the waitress got us the wrong beer we ordered and forgot to bring my husband a coffee latte. I didn't want to waste the beer or cause trouble so we asked to keep the wrong beer but bring us the correct one plus the coffee latte. She disappeared and never saw her again. After a bit of a wait, my husband got another waiter's attention and mentioned that the previous waitress brought us the wrong beer and that he's still waiting for the coffee latte and the correct beer. He brought the right beer but wrong coffee - straight up black coffee in one cup and cold milk in the other. So my husband got the attention of another waitress and explained he didn't receive the coffee latte but regular coffee. She took it back and told the waiter who brought us the wrong coffee (who happened to be near us) what he did in Spanish. He replied that they didn't say coffee latte - not a good look from the staff.  As for the food, I don't recommend Brussels pizza - it had a foul taste and odor. The Rita pizza was nothing special - thin and dry and tasteless sauce. Sadly, we won't be going back here. The experience and food was a huge disappointment.

This was a girls night out meal and the perfect setting for our date.  It is small, intimate, warm and cozy inside, it would be an ideal location for a special occasion. The staff is attentive and knowledgeable about all food and drinks.  The menu is on the smaller side but still has a good variety of options.  Everything we ordered was delicious. Would come back and try more of their pastas.

I ordered from Caviar which I'm aware, is not the same as eating at the restaurant in person.  The oxtail burger I promise tastes like something I could have made at home on the grill.  My burger arrived cold and soggy, the fries were obviously cold and soggy as well - I am NOT impressed. I get better burgers and fries ordering from five guys delivery.  My friend got the oxtail pasta, also cold, sauce leaked all over the bag. Also not great. Maybe it's better in person but I literally threw my burger out half way through.

5 stars of th strength of their "the breakfast" alone. How many times have we brunches and couldn't decide if we want savory or sweet? The breakfast gives you a sampling of everything including a pancake with berry compote, bacon, eggs, home fries, salad I mean perfection. A let down is that you can only order the 4 specialty brunch cocktails and not their other specialty cocktails but you can still order other bar drinks and mimosas. I got a whiskey sour which wasn't great but my meal was. Plus they have plenty of outdoor tables and allow you to use their bathroom or the one at the Mayflower. Great food at a good price. Would return

New favorite brunch spot. Off the beaten (dekalb) path so there's always space. And the food is GOOD. Space is bright an airy just like it should be for a Brooklyn spot. Will go back for dinner some time.
Absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS!! One of my favorite restaurants. All of the ingredients are so fresh, the pasta is homemade and the service is impeccable. Best spot!
Excellent food and amazing staff....very friendly. Nice atmosphere. Easy access by bus or train.

Let's start with the drink-a cocktail with  mezcal and passion fruit!  had two. Then we ordered the octopus for starters-awesome!! Cooked perfectly with a little bit of char. Was not overcooked! Served over a bed of celery, gigante beans, olives and a dressing-sooo good. And yes, although at an Italian restaurant ordered the rib-eye with an order of broccolini. Again, both cooked to perfection and seasoned wonderfully. The ribeye was a thin, bone-in steak but cooked medium rare! It came with baby potatoes and a yummy chimichurri sauce.  Ohhh I think this place is going to be one of my favorite places to go for dinner!

GREAT service and delicious food. I had the fettuccine w/sea scallops and fusilli lunghi and they were both delicious. We also had the rib eye steak and it was cooked perfectly -- so tender! I'll definitely have to come back.

Solid spot for pasta. Lots of wine choices, good beers and cocktails. We ordered a bottle of wine, 2 apps (burrata and octopus) and entrees: papparadelle w rabbit sauce, spaghetti w lobster, oxtail ravioli and the halibut. All tasty though we thought the spaghetti was similar to Lo mein and the fish was slightly over cooked (could've been cooked for 30 sec to a min less) since it was dry. Overall, the meal was good. We were a group of 4 and made a res on Resy.

I finally got to come in for dinner, and I work just across the street!! I was SO impressed by the service! I made the reservation on RESY and did mention about dinner being my friend's bday. I was going to speak with our server (I think his name was Peter?) about maybe bringing the dessert with bday candle. Well, I forgot  But guess what?!! I was SO happy and surprised to see one of the server walking over with the dessert we ordered with bday candle!!! I thought that was very thoughtful! Thank you!! :)

We had an amazing meal a few weeks ago on a busy Monday night.  The staff was so accommodating of our party of 10.  Everything was excellent from cocktails to entrees.  They accommodated some dietary requests easily and were super helpful when ordering wine.  Most of us never order dessert but it all sounded so good that we ordered one of everything and shared around the table.  We are so glad we did!  Dessert is not to be missed!  All in all, a great night and a wonderful find - we'll be back!

Sat at the bar and shared the Oxtail Ravioli and the Ragu Bolognese with a friend and got an Adffogato and Tiramisu for dessert. All around amazing food- the Ravioli (with bone marrow and sage!!) melted in your mouth and was covered in a sauce so good I wanted to lick the plate clean.

I've been here a few times years ago and don't remember being particularly impressed but we went for brunch this weekend and I've definitely changed my mind. I had the avocado Benedict which was really well cooked and flavorful, the home fries were to die for! Just the right amount of crispy. My boyfriend had the lasagna and he was obsessed. Cute atmosphere too, will be back

The cutest, yummiest Italian brunch I've had! I've regretfully only been here twice for brunch. I would love to go here for dinner one day. You must have their bombolones, they are adorable and delicious. The carbonara for brunch is everything. Carbs for brunch is always a success. The braised beef hash is delicious but I personally could have used something like a side salad or something to brighten up the dish. I wouldn't just have this alone personally. All in all, a successful brunch. It's also a great location and the atmosphere is welcoming.

Oh damn. Went here for date night and I don't know where to start on how good it was. Service was amazing. The server had some great suggestions and were on top of taking care of us. We had the deep fried zucchini flowers and shared the spinach gnocchi with smoked eggplant. The bourbon sangria drink special was off. the. hook. Go here for a memorable culinary experience you won't forget! It's worth every penny!
my boyfriend and i's favorite restaurant in new york, can never go wrong with anything on the menu. The vibe of the place is perfect and the drinks are incredible. worth every penny

What a great find for brunch in Fort Greene. Everything was amazing, from the awesome service to the bombolini because they were running behind on our reservation, the delicious oxtail burgers, fluffy pancakes and super crispy bacon was awesome. Don't miss the oat milk latte and the cocktails. We'll definitely be coming back here for dinner!

Sitting in a quaint little street of Italy and enjoying Fettucine cacio e Pepe...except it's a quaint little street in Clinton hill in Brooklyn . This adorable place with well distanced outdoor seating . My pasta was al dente and I like that. The music was lovely and the food was great. Just the portion size is small for the $$.

This is hands-down our favorite brunch in Brooklyn, or anywhere else for that matter! We go at least once a month and get the classic breakfast & avocado Benedict. I do wish they would bring back the standard Benedict with Canadian bacon, but their everyday bacon is delicious, too. We also love the blueberry pancakes with citrus ricotta cream! So happy that this place is doing well post-covid and will continue to visit them. :)

It's tough to run a restaurant during COVID but the staff did a great job. I had the Oxtail burger and other tried the oxtail ravioli, lasagnetta, heirloom beets, burratina, gnocchetti di semolini and fusilli lunch along with several drinks. Everything was well prepared with only one minor error on a drink. Eating outside was fun as we could people watch while we ate.

Oh my goodness, I could cry over their brunch. The avocado benedict is so good that I haven't been able to order anything else since I had it. That said, I do nibble on whatever my husband orders and so far everything has been amazing. Highly recommend.
Great service, great food. Will definitely be back! Ordered lots of apps to split, husband and I both loved our entrees (pasta and rib eye) and the desserts were incredible too.

My favorite restaurant in the city right now. The restaurant is cute, they have great heated outdoor COVID friendly seating (not an unsafe outside-inside situation), the staff is so kind and the food is never not amazing. The oxtail ravioli is my favorite food, I would pick the bowl up and lick it if it was social acceptable. Last time I was there our drinks hadn't come out after maybe a 10 min wait and the waiter apologized and brought us shots on the house to say sorry for the delay. We had not even asked about them because we didn't even feel like it was a big wait, especially on a busy-ish Saturday the day before Valentine's Day. Above and beyond.

This spot serves an amazing brunch!! I came here with a friend on a beautiful fall day and we sat outside. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. We both ordered the Breakfast which comes with two eggs any style, buttermilk blueberry pancakes, home fries, bacon, and market greens. I know this may seem like a lot of food, yet, the portion size of this meal was absolutely perfect! Every single item of this meal was cooked to perfection. I would love to brunch here again! All I can say is visit this restaurant and order the Breakfast, your taste buds will thank you.

Love this place! I've never had a bad meal here. Definitely make a reservation. It's hard to get a table most of the time. I recommend the paccheri with beef cheek ragu. I also loved the steelhead trout dish. I went with two vegetarians for dinner. They loved the variety of vegetarian options available to them.

We had dinner here on a mild night in November.  I was very impressed with the outdoor seating arrangements  - there are booths with plastic between them, but open to the air on one side.  This seems much safer than some of the totally enclosed plastic tents I have seen at some places, and it's attractive.  The food was very good!  We had the burratina, a gnocchi special, the cod special, and the branzino, and everything was very tasty, particularly the branzino.  We also enjoyed our desserts, which were tiramisu and a strawberry marzipan special.  Would definitely go again.

excellent ambiance and exquisite food! I went for dinner while staying in brooklyn on a trip away from d.c. , and the bolognese and ravioli rivaled my own italian grandfather's.

Went there for NYE. Food was decent. Two minutes before midnight as we were gearing up for a toast to celebrate the New Year, the server came over with the bill and asked us to pay. We asked if he could kindly come back in 5 minutes as the clock was about to strike 12 and the last thing we wanted to be using a card machine as everyone around us was celebrating. He said it had to be done before midnight so as the rest of the restaurant was cheering and merry, we were fiddling around paying his tip - which, quite frankly, he didn't deserve at that point. We chose to ring in the new year at this establishment and because of them it fell flat. He should have brought the bill 10 minutes earlier and not at 11.58pm on NYE. Never again.

Wine was great. French wine tasted biodynamic! It was so rich yet light on the palate in a good way and paired great with my lunch. Server was most knowledgeable about the wines. Oxtail burger is off the hook. I mean I'm starting to think that I must make this a monthly ritual. I try to only eat red meat once a month. Perhaps my fix will take place here!

After a misunderstanding I changed my review to one that is positive. This place has great food, good service and managed extremely well. I appreciate so much the time and care management took to reach out. I highly recommend coming here, though be aware because of their popularity the place gets packed and lively but absolutely worth experiencing!
Incredible, top 3 restaurants I've been to in Brooklyn. The oxtail ravioli is out of this world, I can't recommend this place highly enough- you will not regret it.

Simple Italian food done well, with just a touch of modernity. All of the dishes I had were well-balanced with complementary flavors and textures. I had the watercress and pear salad with crispy prosciutto - the prosciutto was a fancier version of bacon bits, which I enjoyed. I also liked the burratina salad with jammy figs, walnuts, maple and an unexpected hit of jalapeño. The pasta was the star of dinner: the strozzapreti pasta was just a little chewy, with these little divots that held the bolognese sauce well.

Can't rave about this spot enough. From their daily spritz, to their spectacular wine (ask for the off-the-menu barbaresco), to their delicious dishes, and amazing service, this place was a 10/10 for me. Would highly recommend!

I tried pretty much everything and had zero complaints... oxtail ravioli, octupus, short rib, salads were all top notch. A solid neighborhood spot.

We ordered the octopus and potato croquettes to start, and then the taglierini and rosemary papardelle for entrees. Every bite was delicious. I will definitely come back!

Came here for Fathers Day with the wife and kids. Was so looking forward to coming because we've been here before and had the oxtail burger. It was amazing and I was looking forward to having it again.  I don't know what happened since the last time we were here but it wasn't the same. We even questioned if it was actually oxtail meat in the burger because it just tasted and had the consistency and texture of regular burger meat. Was so disappointed. I'm keeping from giving this place a "One Star" because I'm going to give them the benefit of the doubt in case I come back here again. But I don't know if I'm just over this place. I hope I'm wrong and they're not scamming people by passing off regular ground meat as oxtail.

My girlfriends and I had an amazing brunch here and it was right up the street from our Airbnb. Everything was phenomenal (Classic Eggs Benedict & Avocado Benedict)! Adorable establishment and pleasant waitstaff.  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in Brooklyn.

I received a very nice email from the owner regarding my negative experience at the restaurant.  It was explained to me that both the owner and chef had left early on the night of our visit and they were concerned that my experience was not acceptable, nor reflective of their normal standard.  So I stand corrected  - the ownership does have pride and care in their food and service, and I must have just gone on an "off night".  I hope to eventually revisit to see what it might be like on a typical night.  I hope they will continue to work with their staff to maintain the level of quality they strive for... even when the chef/owner take a much deserved break from manning the shop.

Great casual atmosphere - and romantic at same time... OUTSTANDING service too... AND the food was even greater! The lettuce salad and burrata appetizer were both outstanding - as was the special chilled summer soup. Rigatoni with shrimp and the halibut special were both beautifully presented and exquisitely prepared. And - the grand finally of the olive oil cake drove me to come right home and write this review! Don't miss this place - whether a local or visitor! Oh yes - the specialty cocktails were great too - we tried their version of a margarita as well as their Manhattan - forgot their special names- (look for the descriptions with tequila or rye...duh...) both excellent - as well as the wine choices. This summer they are expanding to Clinton Hill - calling it Larina Brooklyn - can't wait!!! And - they are on Open Table too!

This is a nice looking place.  We've eaten here three times and the food is consistently good.  The first time we went for brunch.  We had omelettes, but someone at the table next to us had what looked like the most amazing burger.  So we went back for dinner, but unfortunately they don't serve the burger at dinner and they had a bit of a wait.  We opted to stay anyway.  It wasn't so bad as they share the bar next door and you can have drinks until they come get you.  Their octopus was the best I've had in quite some time - had it both times.  For entres we got the cavatelli and also their meat dish (lamb chops, sausage and beef).  We still have to make it back - the burger is definitely one I have to try.

When your father is from Tuscany it is often quite difficult to satiate your father's palate with the traditional "Sause-Laden" "Gravy" style Italian restaurants of New York Lore. However, Aita provides wonderful Osteria style dining in the heart of Clinton Hill. The Octopus was tender, while the numerous pasta dishes specifically the Vongole was flavorfull without trying to overpower the ingredient with wine or other substances.

Just tried to go to Aita for brunch (3:30 pm on a Saturday).  There was no one waiting, and they had an empty table of four composed of two smaller tables of two.  The waitress wouldn't seat us at a table of four, wouldn't pull them apart (which could have been done very easily without disrupting the flow of the restaurant) and strangely wouldn't tell us how long the wait was.  We left feeling confused and very unwelcome.
This is a nice Italian restaurant. Very busy with delicious food. I had incredibly tender, fatty suckling pig with nice crisp skin on top. Definitely recommend.
the best restaurant in clinton hill. food! service! aesthetics! ambience!
I'm reluctant to write this review, because I don't want them to get too crowded! A great neighborhood spot. Cozy and warm, with excellent food.
Great food, relaxed vibe and really nice people that work there. The fish dishes are cooked amazingly well and the steak and chicken are also quite good. Crispy asparagus is a must :)

Ugh? I was trying to take my father out for brunch on Easter, and they sure knew how to ruin the experience. You can't make some guests happy at the expense of others. Just some small place in public housing area, but they're as arrogant there as if they had 3 Michelin stars. Manager lays blame on a hostess, cuz "she's not really a hostess", brrr... You better not.
Wonderful place for a delicious romantic meal. Loved the atmosphere and their pasta dishes are DELICIOUS! great neighborhood spot.

Recently the neighborhood has become inundated with overpriced underwhelming eateries... Aita is NOT one of those, they are excellent - I recommend the trout.  It's hard to imagine that it used to be and infamous drug spot but that was many years ago.
Love this place!  I've been here several times, for both dinner and Brunch but, Brunch is my favorite.  The Beef cheek hash is fantastic! as is the Salmon hash.

I think Aita is a special place.  Authentic and delicious home-style Italian fare, mature and very well crafted cocktails, great atmosphere.  I think what really sets Aita apart is the service; incredibly professional, yet friendly with a personal touch - it makes one feel right at home.   In Brooklyn, with so many good restaurants to choose from, Aita stands out to me as a unique and notable dining experience.
After a couple more conversations on the phone, I finally got my refund for the extra charge... Sloppy, but at least they care about customer service

TERRIBLE SERVICE!  Waited over an hour for our food while watching everyone else who came in after us get served.  Waiter never apologized and lied to our faces, blamed it on the kitchen being backed up even though everyone else was getting their food.  We've been going to this place before it ever got popular, but the smug waiter ruined it for us.

This place is truly a great find. The fried fish sandwich is incredible for brunch. They also have pancakes and other more traditional brunch items. What makes this place special is the decor. Truly picturesque and one of the more beautiful restaurants in Brooklyn

I eat a LOT. And I have lived in Clinton Hill awhile. Last night, we walked into Aita for the first time. I ordered the Oxtail Ravioli and it was seriously the best pasta dish I have ever had. In my entire life. The bartender, Noah, is so sweet, and gave us nice, generous pours of wine. Order the Oxtail Ravioli. You will NOT be disappointed!!!

Finally, the dreadful Speakeasy is replaced! Although the food is relatively pricey, it is delicious. Their grilled octopus salad was splendidly served on a bed of bitter watercress along with a sweet yet sour tangelo. The oxtail ravioli was great, heavy with a thick sauce. Service was great, and overall, this is a warm welcome to Clinton Hill!

The meal was very good.  First course was a Roasted Cauliflower, Radicchio and Chili Vinaigrette, with a glass of 2011 Occhipinti Alter Ego, a white wine version from Aleatico grapes -- fresh, unusual, delightful.  Second course was the Garganelli, with Roasted Butternut Squash, Oyster and Shiitake Mushrooms, and a Leek Sauce.  For the finale, a cup of delicious Neapolitan espresso with a biscotto was perfect.  The hostess, Julia, was very accommodating, the ambience was lovely, and the food was well-done.
The atmosphere was really great and the food LOOKED great but sadly just didn't really taste good.  Oh well.

We waited a LONG time for the Speakeasy successor, and we do have it at last! We went last Monday, the very first night it was opened, and our party of 5 (including a not-so-easy to please toddler, a finicky eater who literally devoured his bowl of custom made cheese cavatelli!) was very please with all their choices: a fantastic vegetable fritto misto, light as air, with a bowl of delicious minty yoghurt sauce, a lovely artichoke salad, a great salumi plate, and great pastas (their very personal twist on spaghetti alle vongole with shishito peppers, lovely oxtail ragout ravioli, and great orecchiette with kale and sausage. We hardly had room for dessert but the one we tried (almond cake) was moist and delicious.. Service was very charming, they have a full license and a small choice of interesting house cocktails, and what to appears a varied and interesting wine list (we had a very good Roero Arneis, a white from Piedmont) In bocca al lupo Aita! We'll be back!
very over rated!!!!food was ok.... needs help with customer service.

Went there tonight for probably the fifteenth time and this story sums it up. The owner meets my wife and me at the door and gives us a big hug, happy to see us again and when I try to describe how happy we are to be there she blurts out, " I know, you feel you are coming home." That's it-going to Aita is like going home, but to a chef that is so incredibly good, so innovative, that it is certainly not like the food I ever ate at home. This restaurant is what I need after a hard week at work. It is a five out of five and even more than that.

The interior is really cool. Speaking of cool it was too cool in there, they did not have the heat on when I went in for a late lunch.  So I had a chill while I ate my food. Also I ordered a fish burger with a side of fries.  The fish burger was suppose to be cod & salmon.  It was probably 99%cod & 1%salmon.  It was bland and pretty flat tasting.  On the menu it said it was $14 but when the bill arrived it was suddenly $15.  The fries tasted like they were the frozen fries you would pick up from a key food--generic, tasteless &reheated.  I think this place is for the transplants(and there are so many now!) who have moved in to fort greene who maybe have a different palette/standards.  As a native, I would not go back to this place or recommend it.

I've been waiting for a place like Aita to open up in Clinton Hill for a long time.  Some friends and I went there for brunch recently and had a terrific experience.  The space is filled with light and gorgeous touches like beautiful textiles on the banquettes and vintage sterling barware.  The staff was gracious and mostly efficient--they're still working out some kinks (ketchup, hot sauce and salt and pepper should be de rigeur items on the table at brunch).  I had the rich and divine fried oyster eggs benedict.  A real treat and my friends had the frittata and the egg BLT.  Everyone enjoyed their food.  The bloody mary was a bit dull--I asked for spicy and no dice.  But it was a big serving in a mason jar.  Nice music, nice ambiance, a really good spot.  I can't wait to go for dinner!  Also, dig the mrs. murphy's soap in the bathroom too--it's the little touches that sometimes make a place feel really great.

So glad to have an excellent, reasonably priced restaurant in the neighborhood. Our food was perfection - oxtail ravioli (portion size a touch small for my husband for the price), cavatelli w. kale and sausage, and an amazing summer salad. Drinks were amazing! Great services, beautiful decor. Only concern - a touch small for us (tables close together). I can get over that though.

This place is amazing. So cute. Nice staff. We had the pancake/bacon/homefries combo and the chocolate french toast...and a side of the cannellini beans. All amazing. I am perplexed at the fact that no one has reviewed the chocolate french toast yet. This stuff is insane. IN-SANE. Although its definitely a dessert breakfast.....i couldnt finish it in one sitting. If you have a healthy brunch appetite...get two other entrees and then split this for brunch dessert. You CANNOT pass it up. Can't wait to go back for another brunch and give dinner a try at this spot!

Hands down my favorite restaurant in Clinton Hill.  Admittedly is really convenient but there are a lot of restaurants in this neighborhood and I still find myself at Aita at least once a week.  The bar at the restaurant is my favorite part of the place -- super laid back, comfortable to eat at, AMAZING drinks, great bartenders (especially Noah).  It's the kind of place you want to stop into at the end of a good day, or a crappy day, to have a drink and relax.  The food is also top notch and always changing.  They typically have a Frito Misto appetizer which is an outstanding sharing item and the Mussels come in a creamy sauce with bacon that demands to be lapped up with bread.  I tend toward the pastas and have never been disappointed.  One of the owners, Giulia, is typically at the restaurant making sure that the guests are having a good time.  I have never personally known a restaurant's owner but she makes you feel really at home and always says hello. Brunch is just as good but definitely get there early as the place quickly fills up.  HIGHLY recommended.

I've only been here for brunch and the food is pretty tasty-- I enjoyed it!  However, I did not enjoy being asked unceremoniously to go sit at the bar after I finished brunch to accommodate a large party when the restaurant was 1/3 empty.  If you are going to hustle people out or to the bar, you're supposed to say something like "can I offer you a mimosa at the bar?", not just basically tell us to beat it.  I would probably go back back again, but I am bit skeptical of the service.

I see Aita all the time on my way to work so I decided to pop in earlier today for brunch. I must say that I was pleasantly surprised. The brunch here is very good. I ordered the 2 scrambled eggs, with bacon, potatoes and a pancake and this meal had wonderful flavors. Everything was coked the way I like it. The pancake (my absolute favorite thing in the world) was very tasty. They definitely know how to make a blueberry pancake here. The prices are pretty moderate, but I do feel that the portion was a bit small. You only get one pancake which is more of the silver dollar variety and you barely get any potatoes. Granted I was able to overlook this because it tasted good, but I like to leave a pace satisfied, not looking for something else to eat in another hour. Most places either give you way too much or not enough at all and Aita unfortunately falls in the latter category. Another small gripe was the bacon; it was a bit overcooked which kind of sucked, but again a very small thing. All in all a pretty good place. I'd definitely do brunch here again.
very good place In Clinton hill fort greene, great staff goes a long way, very nice owner, good food and drinks, great date spot

I used to go to Fiore in Williamsburg, so I was excited to read that the same chef is involved in this place.    I was sooo happy to see one of my favorite dishes included on the menu -- the raw artichoke salad.  (BUT, bring back the shaved parmesan instead of the parmesan "croutons.")   I ordered the canelloni and it was wonderful.  I also had tastes of my friends' dishes and the fish special with the carmelized onions and roasted beets was fabulous, but the chicken dish was somewhat eh by comparison.  I appreciated the fact that, while the place was lively, the four of us could easily have a conversation without having to shout.   The service was excellent / prompt & our waitress was charming and friendly without being overly friendly.    It was a little warm sitting by the window -- that was the only down side.  On the the other hand, I'm the kind of person who would rather be too warm than too cold.

Lovely Sunday dinner with my husband and another couple this past Sunday. Very cozy and romantic atmosphere, my husband and I were seated even though our friends had not yet arrived, and we assured them they would be there in 10 minutes. Friendly staff, delicious drinks and a nice wine list by the glass. I had the best Old Fashioned I have ever tasted, it was perfectly mixed and the right balance of sweet and boozy. All of our food was delicious, especially my sun choke salad with mushrooms-heaven. My risotto was a bit on the sweet side for my taste, almost like a rice pudding with butternut squash flavor, but still well done nonetheless. The meal was well paced, the portions on the generous side (and certainly well priced), and the staff checked on our food and water glasses frequently.  They also have a little bar in the back called Mayflower with a separate entrance which looks like a speakeasy, very nice atmosphere but I ordered the same drink and it wasn't half as good (different bartender). I'll be back!

Totally deserving of the two Michelin stars they have held for years. Was excited to finally try it and I was not let down. Aska is kind of aquavits hip moody little brother who lives in Brooklyn. The dark interior can seem oppressive but the lighting really lets the food shine. Tidy efficient kitchen is in sight and the staff is super attentive. Neve waited for anything! It's prolly better they make you pay ahead that way you can just focus on the food. And I would be lying if I said it was expensive. It is and yes you may leave a little hungry. But, personally I felt fine and not like a stuffed pig by the end. This is quality over quantity and I am ok with that. The neo-Scandinavian food is seafood heavy. But, each bit is refreshing and flavorful and unique. Inspired sauces and flavors drawn from nature rather than pounding the food with spices. This really lets the ingredients sing. I left pictures and am not going to say what was best, because every dish was solid. In fact what was most impressive was that the meal built. Each dish flowed into the next and in a way was better then the last. It was a truly harmonious meal. Worth the splurge for a special occasion. Only wish is that they had liquor and cocktails but not a big deal.

It's all a matter of what you're looking for.  For anyone outside of New York, French Louie is a perfect spot and has very good food.  I would encourage you to go.  For New Yorkers, I would still encourage you to go, but New Yorkers may also understand my frustration in posting this review.  Through the pandemic, French Louie remained open and offered an escape--one that a friend of mine and I took advantage of.  Even through the winter, we would support French Louie because we wanted to make sure it survived the pandemic and thrived on the other side.  This is true to the point that even now, the waiters know us and know our order before we put it in.  But that brings me to the disappointment I had today when we were rushed out because there was a line outside.  I get it--there is money to be made.  But it was a place we thought recognized what we had provided in tougher times and hoped in an odd way it would be reciprocated on the other side.  So it goes.  Despite the two star review, it is a great spot.  Just disappointing for New Yorkers who were there in the worst of times.  Fortunately, there are other spots close by for us!

visited french louie 3 times in the last several months - group of 6 at 7 pm, group of 4 at 9 pm and my wife and i at 6 pm - and never had a bad experience. who else serves a bloody mary with half an okra, an olive and a piece of some root vegetable as decoration? genius. absolutely love their huge moules normande and their tuna or beef tartar. our guests ordered different dishes and all loved them. service is friendly and efficient. to reduce waste, they serve bread only when you ask for it. and as a bonus for this German, they have not one but 2 German - and several others - beers on tap, Gaffel Koelsch and Hofbraeuhaus Dark. only thing missing for my taste buds are a hearty french onion soup and a good bouillabaisse. however, their special soup of lentils and mushrooms last night was delicious too.
Very cool spot with classic French dishes and pretty good wine list. Wish I made it in more often.

My friend and I had a stunning meal here. Each dish was more beautiful and flavorful than the last. Service was impeccable from start to finish. A treasured addition to Atlantic ave

Service was great and wait staff was friendly. Must go!!
Went for dinners during NY restaurant week. The steak frites was awesome! Although the duck confit came out too dry. Plating was gorgeous. Would try again.

So good.  Food is great.  Service is great.  Atmosphere is laid back and cozy.  The bartender is the man.   Loved it.

The food is good and the ambiance is excellent. The appetizers are gorgeous especially the foie gras and the mussels. And the steak is a must order with chips. I always order Old fashioned for a drink! I like sitting put doors but always bring a repellent unless you will be bitten to death.

Yum! We were here for brunch and it was delicious! The cauliflower soup was superb as was the apple turnover! We both ordered the Bloody Mary and whoa holy yum! One of the better ones I've had since living in NYC. We will definitely be coming back for more.
Went there for lunch recently and was underwhelmed with their food.  Got their burger and fries...nothing special. Service was attentive.

I am always happy with this scrumptious cuisine. Be prepared to wait the length of time it requires to prepare and cook as it is made just for the diner! I do not eat gluten nor dairy, but Love French cuisine. They have accommodated me the several times I've eaten there. The staff are quite knowledgeable and professional. Sharing is met with respect as is each request we've made. Enjoy. Give your tastebuds a treat! Subtle, refined and elegant. Taste, that is. Dress is comfortable.

Backyard is great, perfect for summer.  Service was solid.  The food just wasn't great with exception of escargot.  Smoked mackerel had no smoke taste. I've been here a few times and this place continues to impress me. The egg bowls they have for breakfast are fantastic- try the mushroom one it's great and the sausage one might be even better. The staff is always super friendly and the drinks are amazing. I've noticed that on the weekends between 10AM and 1130 is crowded, so before or after I've been able to pretty much walk in.

One of my favorite restaurants!!! Delicious, interesting food, beautiful ambience, etc etc. My one critique: went there for lunch yesterday and got the grilled trout po boy. Not only is the food here amazing, but so is the service. Had my first experience here on a Friday night- it was packed. We had the frenchie salad, the sardines, the pappardelle, the beef bourguignon, and my dinner date had the steak. Had brunch here and it was delicious. Service was friendly. Make a reservation though, this place gets busy!

I be been here a few times before and it has always been good. Tonight was excellent. Amazing smoked mackerel app and trout main course. I was expecting the bill to be much higher.

Wonderful experience!  We didn't have reservations but able to get a table for Sunday Brunch.  Service is excellent and food was very good.  Everyone in my group was happy and would return when we are in the area.

With so many places to eat in Brooklyn/NYC, its not uncommon to say that I have been to a local place only 2 or 3 times since living here (7 years, where did the time go!?).  French Louie is different-- I have probably dined here 15+ times-- sometimes with my parents or large groups of friends, and sometimes just me and my baby, for a glass of rose and their gougeres.  The food is consistently great and service is usually spot-on.  Two very enthusiastic thumbs up.

My husband and I went out here on a friday night after randomly finding this place nearby us on Yelp and I gotta say that the food and service was great. Delicious but price is high...def a treat yourself spot. Great decor and there's outdoor seating. Had the fried chicken and at that point i knew my life was finally complete. Order the fried chicken, you'll understand.

Amazing food and great service by the staff -- had the gnocchi and pan fried skate with profiteroles as the dessert.  Waitress was very attentive and multiple people on staff asked us about our experience throughout the meal.
Staff was SO FRIENDLY.  Went for brunch. Accommodating, pleasant. Coffee was tasty. Eggs with goat cheese was a little rich. Will return.

High price, but still a good value at that price point. Food is consistently delicious, with multiple seasonal dishes on the menu. Service is consistently great. And ambience is nice. We keep coming back. And, based on how consistently busy they are, I think the neighborhood agrees.

Me and my native New Yorker friend popped into French Louie after my red eye flight from the west coast. It was Labor Day Sunday. We were promptly seated toward the back of the bistro. Food was good but our server seemed miserable and it made for an uncomfortable dinner. I went for my birthday and it was disappointing and tense. LOVE IT - avocado toast is amazing. The pickled zebra tomato was a great surprise. And the patio is perfect to hangout in summer.

Great spot for brunch. Nice and casual atmosphere with extremely friendly service. Came here with a group on a Sunday and didn't even have to wait for a table. Croissant French toast - need I say more!
Love this place.  Great energy, and great service.  Had the lamb which was delicious

Went before a Bruce Springsteen concert for dinner. Food was fabulous!!! Steak Frites was very tasteful and perfectly cooked. Steamed mussels are a MUST have. But most of all the service is AMAZING from hostess to server. Can't wait to go again.
Excellent scallop starter but the bluefish was not cooked enough. Service is excellent. Wines too expensive.

This place is absolutely delightful. My husband and I came here for our anniversary and the food and service was impeccable from start to finish. The scallop ceviche was light and refreshing. By the end of the meal we were deciding all of our friends who we wanted to bring here. This place is such a wonderful addition to the neighborhood!

Great spot! Love the low-lit, trendy atmosphere they created, food is of high standards and the drinks are well made. Plus they don't push you right out the door once you put down your fork. Loved it!

Review for dinner on a Saturday night.  For 1st-timers, we had a wonderful time.  Excellent service, very creative dishes and wonderful decor! Dessert and wine choices were amazing!   You had me at goat cheese sorbet and oh man how can I forget the profiteroles...simply delicious!

This was a great little stop. Very quaint. I would definitely go back. Really cool neighborhood. Great service. Tasty bites. Great drinks. 5 for ambiance and 3 or 4 for food. Had steak that was too well done and fatty. Muscles were okay.

Food and cocktails are delicious. Very fresh, simple and well-balanced dishes. Something for everyone including those with a refined palate. Great presentation and service. Bustling and louder in main space. Quiet and pretty patio space for warmer weather.

Absolutely delicious food - try the anchovy frites and the gnocchi - and great service. The waiter brought out two kinds of wine to try based on my request for a recommendation - loved the attentiveness and help!

French Louie is a French-American bistro from the owners of Buttermilk Channel. One of my most loved places to dine in Brooklyn. Great food, great service, great times. I highly recommend.... Sit in the garden if possible.
Came here with a big group including the bf and sat in the backyard.  Everything was perfect.  Apps, entree, wine, service, ambience.  This place is a gem.
Fantastic , brunch today with great food and great service. An attentive staff and all the food came out at the same time piping hot and delicious .. Thank yo
Incredible food, top-notch service, terrific wine list, all in a relaxed and friendly atmosphere.
Lovely food, attentive staff and warm atmosphere. Dinner is awesome but it's also a great spot for a weekday business lunch. My favorite dish I have tried so far is the mussels in dijon mustard.

Cool vibe inside. Had a good brunch but expected it to be more memorable food based on how awesome things are at Buttermilk channel. Go to check out the design and have a snack and a cocktail. I would skip brunch.

5 Stars for the Eggs Louie. Space is nice, garden is great, staff are cool. Nice addition to the neighborhood, and I hope they do well.

One of the best meals I have had in a while. Started with the oysters and gougeres. They were superb! I highly recommend the trout- perfectly cooked! I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu though.

Had Saturday brunch in February at Louie. First off, the service was exceptional. We wandered in off the street and they we able to seat us in exactly the amount of time they promised. A rare feat. Wow! Beyond expectations! The snap pea salad which is a seasonal delight was amazing and I had the Bavette steak which was cooked perfectly and tasted unbelievable! The decor was stunning (um gorgeous terrace?!!) and the waitstaff was super knowledgable and friendly. Total hit!

I am sure by now you know that these are the people who own Buttermilk Channel, everyone's favorite brunch venue.  I was not skeptical at all about trying out this place because of their rep and I was not disappointed.  definitely great french cuisine.   I enjoyed the duck and the Lion's tail drink.    both great.  The setting of the restaurant is dimly lit, not intimate by quiet.  There is also a nice deck in the back.  They definitely put some thought into it.  Great date venue or classy, wine sipping spot for a group of friends

Lovely Brooklyn restaurant. The Eggs Louie were delicious. Perfectly poached eggs on toasted croissant. Nice wait staff and pleasant atmosphere. They have outdoor area but with rain I didn't have a chance to check it out.
The food was very delicious but their service was so-so. They must have been slammed. Would try again, especially in the spring and summer when the outdoor area is open!
This place blew my mind. One of the best meals I've had in New York. The decor is stylish and intimate. The staff are knowledgeable and polite. I will definitely be coming back here.

Horrible dining experience on Sunday April 9th.  The lamb special ($30) was served nearly raw.  When we asked for it to be cooked a bit more, the request was met with a dirty look.  When it came back out, it was still ridiculously undercooked.  A second complaint about the undercooked lamb fell on deaf ears.  They made no effort to accommodate us or mke it right.  Never again.
Best brunch I've had in a loooooong time. Get the eggs louie or whatever the eggs benedict dish is called. its amazing.
Excellent food (duck breast, frites, mussels) and really skilled friendly servers. The decor is lovely, minimalist chic, including the outdoor space.

Extremely salty from appetizer to entree, I lost my appetite halfway through because it was so unbearably salty. Shouldn't call itself a French restaurant - there's nothing French about the food and it really tarnishes the name. Service started out friendly but eventually left our water glasses unfilled for the second half of the meal.

I rarely compliment service, I normally don't care enough to, however I just had dinner at French Louie and was blown away by the amazing food and ambiance at this restaurant. What blew me away more was the service we received. I advise everyone who goes to French Louie to ask for Meredith. The service we received from her made me and my friends feel as if we were part of a "family". Meredith seemed to take a genuine interest in us and I could not be more grateful for that. She was so polite and kind it blew me away. Words cannot express how amazing Meredith made us feel. This was a great way to round out our vacation and I'll think about French Louie forever! I recommend the Le Grand Socca and Meredith!

Maybe it was an off-night, but I had dinner here and everything I tasted (the steak, the papardelle, fries) was oversalted. Service was pretty decent. and cocktails were strong I had high hopes for this place but don't think I will come back .

Based on the reviews here, seems like I dined at a completely different place. Only the wine, mint tea, and spiced chocolate pot dessert were passable. Scallop Ceviche too lemony. Gougeres way salty. Grilled Trout was just awful -- flavorless, layered over cold, hard, half boiled potatoes and a strange mix of radishes and cucumbers. It's not easy to swallow a very high price bill for bad food. Will not return or recommend.

I've been here now for brunch, lunch, and a beer. All three times have been without complaint. Try the creme brûlée French toast (brunch) or chicken paillard (lunch); they are to die for, and the staff are truly charming and friendly.

my lamb was perfection- tender, flavorful and so juicy the grilled escarole and omelette complemented it just perfectly  by far my favorite part of the meal. the steak tartare was okay - I'm not a huge fan of mustard seeds or pickles so wasn't really my speed -personally prefer to taste more of the flavors from the meat. at the end of the meal we had tea and I just loved it's presentation. nice decor, friendly service - excited to try more items on their menu!
Warm, cozy place. Interesting and  diverse menu, however some dishes fell a little flat. Overall good food though, and I will definitely return

My friends and I were happy to find this place after the restaurant we planned to go to was closed for a wedding. Lovely atmosphere - modern, unfussy, contemporary. Prices were more than fair. Great beer selection. There were two oyster selections and the ones we chose were shucked and cleaned nicely. We also had the heirloom tomatoes - a nice seasonal menu item. Everyone at the table enjoyed their entrees and the lime merengue tart was excellent. The house-made amaretto for desert was also a highlight.

French Louie seemed very inviting while we explored Atlantic Ave, so we couldn't resist having dinner there! The back patio did not disappoint. Smoked sardines were top notch, and so was the "roasted king mushroom". The bread on the grand socca dish was burned, but the gracious staff more than made up for it. The chef (or the manager?) came to our table to apologize and gave us extra attention. I've rarely seen this kind of courtesy in any restaurant.
Perfect brunch spot. Enjoyed the creme brûlée French toast and steak tartare. Both were real treats for the taste buds. Great atmosphere and service as well.

This is a wonderful French Bistro. Great atmosphere and excellent food. Seared scallop appetizer was delicious, mushroom entree was sublime, profiteroles for desert were only mediocre though. Despite dessert experience, this place is terrific - would love to return on my next trip from San Francisco.

A delightful place for lunch (haven't yet tried it for dinner) - everything so well prepared and fresh, with special compliments on the heirloom tomato soup, avocado tartine, peches melba, and butterscotch pudding. The staff is welcoming and accommodating, and the dining areas very comfortable. I'm usually not a fan of outdoor dining, but the patio at French Louie is lovely, with a large awning  providing protection from the sun.

Came here during restaurant week on a Wednesday night February 2016. It was packed and for good reason! The food is absolutely delicious with each plate invoking a myriad of flavors all melding together in perfect unison. Now, I  am not at all familiar with French cuisine but if you've got an appetite for something different than the usual American fare, try this place. The plates are smaller than typical places in that you probably won't have any leftovers to bring home but will be satisfied and full. The space is small too with tiny square tables packed closely together. It's a loud restaurant so don't expect to hear your dining partner very well. I heard older people (50/60s) leaving the restaurant saying the food was great but the noise was unbearable. I can understand that sentiment but it's not enough to keep me away! If you want to enjoy really delicious gourmet, artfully crafted dishes you must come. You truly get what you pay for here. This is quality over quantity. You won't be disappointed.

I've been five times in the past few months. The food is fantastic and the staff and service are terrific, BUT the sound level is literally deafening. I'd only go back with earplugs. It's really a shame because if you didn't come out deaf after having missed half of the conversation this would be a great place.

My husband and I ate here for our anniversary and it was fantastic! We started with the mussels Piperade and they were my favorite part of the entire dinner. We shared the cote de boeuf and it was so flavorful and perfectly cooked. Wine was great, service was great!

Had a birthday brunch here last weekend. There were 12 of us, mixture of adults and kids. Firstly they allowed us to book in advance which was really helpful. The food was delicious and the drinks unlimited and they even did me a custom menu with my name at the top. The staff were really helpful and attentive and the food was good (madelaines with a creamy sauce to start, mixture of mains including burger, poached eggs, vegetarian option and french toast) all of which were epic. Can' t recommend this place enough. Unfortunately it rained, but we will definitely be back here in the summer when the garden is open.

Brunch here was weird and horrible.  Bad, bad coffee--very mineral-ly with a strange aftertaste.  This was a red flag and we should have got out then.  Regrets.  We had the trout tartine and the cordon bleu--everything--I mean everything--had a sour, bitter taste.  The service was helicopter mom, every three seconds, we were being asked if everything was ok.  That's not attentive, we felt harassed  This was the worst brunch that we have had in many years and we go out a lot.
Excellent food and service.  I wouldn't take young children because it is a small space, but my teenagers loved it.

Had a amazing dinner here with fantastic friendly, on-point and enthusiastic service. Beautiful space and it will now be one our my go-to place. The combination of space, service, good drinks and food is a 5 star - really hard to find these days. Owner of Buttermilk Channel brings his impeccable hosting over. Awesome experience overall.

Love this restaurant. I've had brunch on weekends and dinner; both are excellent. The garden in the back is beautiful, quiet and shaded in summer. Inside can be a little noisy, as almost all NY restaurants do. Service is always excellent, knowledgeable and friendly. Reservations for my birthday dinner, even though I kept adding people one by one to the table on a busy Saturday, were not a problem at all. Brunch prices are surprisingly reasonable for the city. I'll keep coming back, with great pleasure.

I really want to like French Louie (really enjoy Buttermilk Channel and want another local go-to restaurant), and have gone there twice, hoping for good service and food. The first time was only okay, but it was their first week being open, so I cut them some slack. Last night we returned, and regretted it. A) my husband and his sister got food poisoning from the steak tartare, B) despite being completely empty at 930 on a Sunday, they seated our party of 5 in the back, crammed into a 4-seater with an extra chair and an incomplete table set-up, and C) the food was simply not tasty and the service lackluster.  I don't even want to bother going into the details of the food because it was so unmemorable. But I won't be returning unless they revamp their menu, kitchen staff, and service level.
Love French Louie! Good food and good people. They go out of their way to make customers happy!

OK, so I'm not sure what it would be like eating inside; the decibel level was 92-95 - similar to standing next to a jackhammer. The garden however, was quiet and lazy with a warm summer breeze wafting through. There's enough room out there so that there is no cramming in. That's just the beginning. The waitstaff was genial, jovial, and efficient - aand then came the food. My own dishes were the smoked sardine appetizer - perfectly smoky, slightly briny with a tapenade butter and whole grain bread accompaniment. My main, a dish of papardelle with 'smack your momma' merguez sauce was like a 4th of July fireworks display of flavor zings - and the bed of pasta perfectly al dente. A knockout! Our shared dessert selection of profiteroles and the lemon meringue tarte - neither cloyingly sweet) provided the perfect finish. With our Cotes du Ventoux wine at table, we could have been in Provence, yet we were in the heart of Brooklyn, with a perfect staffer from Long Island (she admitted it). We're going to wear this place out!

My boyfriend and I have tried the smattering of French restaurants along Atlantic Ave between Bond and Brooklyn Heights... French Louie is BY FAR our favorite. The food was amazing, starting with the octopus and "frenchie" salad and ending with the mussels (app), Bavette steak, and spiced chocolate pot de creme... Truly delicious! What really made our experience five stars was our server, Brian, who went above and beyond to make us feel special (it was my boyfriend's birthday dinner), checking in frequently, and making sure our wine was always topped off. Really, an exceptional dinning experience. Thank you Brian and French Louie!
No comment

I hope to try an earlier hour next time. Really could do wo the sourpuss greeting. It can't be that hard to replace a hostess.
The food is awesome, but it's not surprising since it's coming from owners from Buttermilk Channel. The thing i adore about this space is the outside space. Always nice to dine al' fresco in NY!

The atmosphere is lovely. The service attentive but not cloying. Great wine recommendations too. But the food was disappointing. The chicken looked perfectly crisped but lacked seasoning. I was so excited to try this place out for brunch after never being able to get into Buttermilk Channel. I am so lucky that I just happened upon this place. It was about 10:30pm and I was walking in the rain to find somewhere to get some grub. Not a huge American portion, but something made with thought that would leave me with a great memory. Found it here!  I walked in and was immediately able to sit at the bar. Ordered the duck breast with mashed potatoes and olive spread, "Allard." I ordered it medium rare. It was phenomenal!!  The duck was a nice portion and included the skin. And if you truly love duck, then you wouldn't want to miss out on the skin. It was tender, juicy and so full of flavor!  The potatoes were great. The olives left me with the desire to make a serious effort to try to incorporate more olives into my daily schedule. I almost settled up and left after that until I realized that they had desserts!!  Ordered profiteroles with fennel ice cream and a nice drizzle of sugary goo. It was the perfect dessert!  And it really represented French portions and flavors well. Not swimming in goo. Just enough to make you enticed to sop it all up with the flaky, croissant-like profiteroles as the fennel ice cream melted. I told the bartender who served me with a smile the whole time that if I could, I would have licked the entire plate clean. The ice cream was just delicious. Thick, dense, fresh ice cream that really left me satisfied. The only down point of the experience was when I left to walk back to the apartment we are staying in and realized that I could have been dining here since Tuesday!  But we leave to return to our home in Atlanta tomorrow. Wish I could have eaten here again and again. And I truly hope they remain successful for next time I am in town so I can eat the exact same menu items. Such delicious food!!  And with the whole meal mentioned above, the bill was about $35.00. This food was made with some serious thought and love. Cannot wait to come back!

I came here looking forward to a steak and martini dinner, which I have enjoyed a few times at French Louie. I was disappointed on a couple of fronts. 1. The martinis are no longer served in martini glasses. They are now using those thimble-sized little "coupe" glasses that so many bars are now using for cocktails. There is nothing worse than ordering a cocktail and receiving it in one of those offensively tiny glasses, especially a martini. 2. The steak comes with salad. What happens when you put a hot piece of meat on the same plate as salad? Not only was the salad wilted, but tonight, half the salad was actually rotten. Garbage. Had to scrape it to the side after inadvertently eating rotten salad with my steak. Overall, I am sad that I can't depend on my neighborhood go-to French Louie anymore, for a great martini and steak dinner. Especially for the price, it should be very consistent and reliable.

I had the bellini, which was perfect, and my friends had cocktails and were very pleased. The staff was fun and kind and super attentive. I'll definitely be back. Thanks French Louie!!!

So I had kept seeing French Louie pop up on a the hot and trendy lists. I also saw that  they had worked out the initial kinks that new restaurants face. After finally eating there I have to say, I don't get it. We ordered the pork and rabbit rillettes as an appetizer, it had the consistency of tuna salad and didn't have much flavor. It even looked like it had rolled over onto its side when the waiter was bringing it out even though it was upright when it made it to the table. For my entree I had ordered the roast duck breast Allard. When it was served it was served with the grey side up which made for an ugly presentation. I had flipped it over to see the whole piece and there was a nice crisp skin that was sitting in the jus that would have made the presentation 100% better if it was served that way. Aside from the presentation I had also found it a little over cooked and tough. I had tried my girlfriends also, she had ordered the roasted king mushroom and while it was ok, it seemed to miss what it was aiming for, there were earthy tones but the sauce was overly salty sweet and sour all at the same time. She had also noted that the pieces of potato she had in there were under cooked. Aside from the food, the service was nothing to write home about. Our waitress came over and then disappeared for a extended periods of time. By the time we were done with our meal we were itching for the check and still couldn't locate out waitress,which after a mediocre meal can be frustrating because you just want to leave it all behind.

The good news is that, over a year later, French Louie has definitely caught on.  You now need a reservation for peak meal times, and may not get one in your preferred slot.  Based on my experience this past Friday, the place now gets super crowded and so, unfortunately, super noisy.  The food is still of high quality, the menu remains smallish but varied and challenging, and the wine list still includes a lot of good values.  The service on a busy evening is understandably a bit frazzled, and the noise level makes communicating with the servers a challenge, but the basics (food delivery and presentation, pick up of empty plates, etc.) are all handled professionally.  I certainly intend to go back, but I will try to find quieter times and avoid peak slots on Fridays and Saturdays, when the noise level makes normal conversation impossible and thus reduces your pleasure in a fine meal.  Or I'll come in the summer, when the delightful garden is open.

We intended to dine at La Vara but lost our table thanks to the Brooklyn Bridge being closed to traffic. (No fault to the restaurant... we blame Mayor de Blasio and the MTA for being an hour late for our reservation!) So -- finding ourselves all the way in the area between Boerum Hill and the Slope in Brooklyn, we franticly scoured Yelp on our IPhone for something we could walk to with ease. On Atlantic Avenue was a place I had heard about from friends... French Louie. Let's start with the hostess -- as warm, friendly, charming a professional as one would hope to engage on a frustrating evening. She went out of her way to accommodate our party even though the place was packed -- and it was a Saturday night! Now let's move to the physical restaurant -- a neat bar, small, intimate, very "Brooklyn hip" without being douche, and a restaurant that is not overly loud, elegant without being pretentious, warm, inviting... we instantly felt very comfortable. (There is a large, outdoors back dining area that must be delightful in the summer.) Now... the menu. EVERYTHING sounded delicious... with the small-plates reading as inviting as the entrees. We shared an order of gougeres (small, cheese-filled puffs) and roasted brussels sprouts with grains in a harissa yogurt. Wonderful. The "Frenchie" salad was far more delicious than the simple detailing on the menu -- the bacon was hand-cut and perfect. Most of us opted for different steak/frites dishes -- the aged-steak was perfect and each of our meals came to the exact specification of what we ordered -- be it rare, medium rare, etc. We got what we wanted. The only disappointment was at desert... the spiced chocolate pot de creme with orange madeleines was insane... craving it now just thinking about it... but the house-made ice cream (that evening coconut) unfortunately had too many ice-crystals to make it stand out. That was the ONLY less-than-perfect aspect to this fine restaurant. Did I mention that the service was impeccable?  Attentive without being annoying. If you want a fine meal, an eclectic French menu, this is a wonderful choice.

My stomach is awarding Bar Tano a full five stars, despite having dined in close quarters.  We were on our way to a hot ticket at the Bell House and the place was pretty packed.  But although it was cozy, I believe I've just eaten the best pizza of my life. The hubs and I shared an insalata mista and white bean bruschette, which were both good, but when our entrees arrived, we barely came up for air.  I had the funghi pizza with smoked mozarella and fontina, and I don't know if I'll ever be the same.  The pizzas are a bit large for one person but I downed all but one slice.  The crust was super thin, but not so thin I had to eat it with a knife and fork, and the toppings were plentiful. No need for tomato sauce when you have the awesome flavors of juicy sauteed mushrooms and gooey smoked mozzarella battling it out on your slice.  I'm nearly at a loss for words thinking about it.  The hubs had the chicken scallopini and he was so into it, he basically inhaled it. We did pause for a moment to notice the attractive Old World-looking bar and the odd fact that the front window was filled with bottles of Campari (though after a Christmas Eve experiment with the stuff, I'd consign mine to the window, too).   Have to say I liked it much better than its big brother, Bar Toto.  Can't wait to go again.

The first thing I noticed walking into the restaurant was a contrast between the somewhat gritty 3rd ave area and the restaurant - the decor and lighting represented a casually refined atmosphere. My meal, a panini was good, but not great. I thought it could use a bit more cheese or somethig else to take it to another level. The included chips were really good. Overall though for the price, it is hard to complain. I'll definitely be visiting here again soon for drinks or to check out the other menu choices. Overall just a very nice change of pace from the other 5th and 7th avenue offerings.

i went on a sunday night with my husband before going to a show at the bell house (it's conveniently located nearby), and was surprised to see there was a wait for a table at 9:30pm. we decided to stay and eat at the bar, which is a beautiful bar, by the way, with a large assortment of italian liqueurs. i ordered a negroni which was done well and served up, and my hubby got a peroni on draft. the cocktails are all around $9, which seems to be pretty standard for the area these days. anyways, we were starving and i ordered a margherita pizza with the addition of ricotta (a tip from yelp), and he got a burger and gorganzola-walnut bruschetta. the bruschetta never came as an appetizer, but was delicious nonetheless. his burger was served panini-style with homemade potato chips to accompany and he devoured it. my pizza looked lovely, but i was disappointed by its lackluster taste. maybe salt was missing? the crust was a little dense and tasteless and there was no tang to the marinara. i'm sure i'll be back because i loved the bar but i'll avoid the pizza next time and maybe stick to the bruschetta.

My wife and I made the mistake of going to Bar Tano tonight. We had the WORST service we have ever had in any borough of NYC. First, we sat at the bar while waiting for a table and watched another party of 2 walk in off the street and be sat before us.  Our appetizers came with our meal, my wife received the wrong entree and I was forced to eat my entree while she waited for hers.  She then received the incorrect entree for a second time. She originally ordered a mozzarella panini with pesto. The first panini to come out was ricotta and eggplant.  When it came out again it was missing the pesto. When we told our server about it, he came back and slammed a cup of pesto on our table and walked away. We then decided to leave with her only taking two bites out of her panini.  We were only comped for her entre, even though our entire meal was ruined. The worst part was that our server never even apologized. I would never go there again. Our ENTIRE night was ruined and all we received was 12 dollars off our bill.  I'm usually not picky about service, especially when a place is new, but this was ridiculous.

These fries are prepared the Belgian way for sure, and are of quality, but they had no salt on them to speak of, so they were under-seasoned as a result. I was rather surprised that this would be the case since everyone raves about this place. To me, this is a big deal and one that can be easily corrected. I make fries at home a lot that are damn good (granted I roast mine in olive oil in the oven and season them properly), so I am generally underwhelmed when I get them out (you just can't get the same flavor frying french fries versus roasting them). That said, these have the potential to be much better. The quality of the fries was great and the black truffle sauce was good as well (get the sauce on the side as I did to avoid having your fries drowning in sauce). I also wish that they had more Belgian beer options. I went with Hoegaarden, which is good, but not really what I wanted. Not some place I would run to, but I would have it again, provided I brought salt with me next time to properly season them. I will say that these are not oily, despite being fried twice, so the execution was good.
